Cannot save if no location is specified. In this case, the only option is to 
discard the changes.

Need to change logic in LaunchConfigurationDialog to recognize situations when a save is 
impossible (such as a shared config with no location specified) and show a different dialog, one 
that doesn't offer a save option, but simply asks whether to discard changes or not.

Added support to show either a 'Save changes' or 'Discard changes' dialog when they are unsaved 
changes depending on whether the changes are 'saveable' changes.  At present, the only 
unsaveable change is an invalid name.  In order for an empty location for a shared config to be 
handled as an unsaveable change, we would need some more API on the tabs, similar to 'isValid()', 
maybe called 'isValidToSave'.  The reason is that there are really two levels of validity.  The 
first, handled by 'isValid()' means valid to launch.  The second deals with valid to save.  The only 
other alternative would be to consider the two notions to be one and the same thing, but this leads 
to problems since then configs could not be saved with unlaunchable values.  On the other hand, 
shared config support will probably be removed in the near future, so perhaps we could just wait.  
Darin, let me know what you think and I can create a new PR for the extra API if you think this a good 
idea.

It looks like shared configs will *not* be removed.

* Add API as #canSave()
* Default implementation is "true"
* Common tab overrides with "shared" logic

(Can we use the tab's error message as a hint to why the save cannot be made?)

Fixed in LaunchConfigurationDialog, ILaunchConfigurationTab, CommonTab and 
AbstractLaunchConfigurationTab.
